required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Age and Sleep Apnea Syndrome: Clinical Features and Outcomes

brief_summary.textblock: By clinical record review, this retrospective study aims to compare the different age groups of patients with obstructive sleep apnea, who were diagnosed and treated in Taipei Veterans General Hospital, Taiwan.

detailed_description.textblock: This retrospective study aims to compare the characteristics of patients with obstructive sleep apnea (OSA). Patients with sleep problem and received a prior polysomnography at Taipei Veterans General Hospital during Jan. 1, 2016 to Dec. 31, 2017 will be enrolled. Obstructive sleep apnea (OSA) is defined by an apnea-hypopnea index(AHI) at least 5/hr with compatible symptoms. Their clinical record will be reviewed and data including demography, polysomnography, comorbidities and details related to upper airway structure will be collected. The charactereistics would be compared with Student's t tests, Mann-Whitney U tests, or Chi square tests if appropriated.

primary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: Counts of apnea/hypopnea events per hour

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: The body mass divided by the square of the body height.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: The diameter from supramentale to gonion.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: Self-reported comorbidities including cardiovascular disease, stroke, hypertension, diabetes mellitus, hyperlipidemia, lung disease, anxiety, depression.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: The ratio of the total time spent asleep (total sleep time) in a night compared to the total amount of time spent in bed.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: The number of arousals and awakenings as a frequency per hour of sleep.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through study completion, an average of 1 year
secondary_outcome.description: The number of times per hour of sleep that the blood's oxygen level drop by 4% from baseline.

intervention.description: Age<40 years old is chosen as the cutoff value.
The diagnosis of OSA (obstructive sleep apnea) relies on polysomnographic data showing an apnea-hypopnea index at least 5/hr with compatible symptoms.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with sleep complaints and received PSG in sleep center in Taipei Veterans General Hospital
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who ever received treatment for OSA
- Patients cannot tolerate PSG examination
- Patients cannot complete the questionnaires before and after PSG examination

facility.name: Chest department, Taipei Veteran General Hospital
